Will altcoins really survive without btc?The altcoin market is rapidly evolving, and it is likely that some of these digital currencies will eventually be able to stand on their own without depending on Bitcoin to determine their price actions. While Bitcoin was the first fully developed cryptocurrency and currently serves as the dominant coin, much like the US dollar, individuals often hedge their tokens and altcoins against Bitcoin when they perceive a risk in holding onto a particular altcoin. This practice can result in the value of these tokens dropping when Bitcoin declines and appreciating when Bitcoin rises.

comments.author: DOH!
comments.body: Bitcoin took the lead and ushered in the blockchain era. bitcoin has always been at the top but it is altcoins (specifically ETH) that really give a boost to greater readiness and adoption in the crypto space. To my mind bitcoin and altcoins are closely correlated, it makes for diversity. Much of the altcoin's price movement follows bitcoin's trend but not absolute or in some cases vice versa. I think the relationship of bitcoin and altcoin is inseparable in value, bitcoin falling and altcoin falling is normal and it has nothing to do with the meaning of existence or not! I think that's what is unique and interesting about crypto.
